qas.question: What is an important number when it comes to guns engaging an aircraft?
What can be used to determine the maximum distance for an AA gun?

answers.text: only the ascending part of the trajectory

qas.question: What is the term used to describe the height that a projectile would go to if it was fired vertically?
Few AA guns are able to fire which way?

context: <a0_0>The maximum distance<a0_0/> at which a gun or missile can engage an aircraft is an important figure. However, many different definitions are used but unless the same definition is used, performance of different guns or missiles cannot be compared. For AA guns <a1_0>only the ascending part of the trajectory<a1_0/> can be usefully used. One term is 'ceiling', <a2_0>maximum ceiling<a2_0/> being the height a projectile would reach if fired vertically, not practically useful in itself as few AA guns are able to fire <a3_0>vertically<a3_0/>, and maximum fuse duration may be too short, but potentially useful as a standard to compare different weapons.
